english_translation: Narrated by Ali: The Prophet ﷺ entered upon one of his wives and found with her date stones which she was using for dhikr. He said: 'What is this?' She asked: 'And what is it, O Messenger of Allah?' english_translation: Narrated by Ali: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: Whoever washes his Muslim brother, cleanses him, does not violate his modesty, does not look at his private parts, does not mention anything bad about him, then escorts him, prays upon him, and sits until he is lowered into his grave, shall come out from his sins as if purified. Then Zaid ibn Ali was asked about washing the deceased: He should be placed on his washing platform directed toward the Qiblah with his private parts covered. Then perform for him the ablution as for prayer. Then wash his head, beard and entire body with water mixed with lote leaves. Then wash his head, beard and entire body with water and camphor. Then wash his head, beard and entire body with plain water with nothing mixed in it. This constitutes three washings. Then dry him with a cloth. Then place perfume on his head and beard, follow the marks of his prostration with camphor. Then spread his shrouds which are three garments: a shirt, a wrapper, and a shroud. Then dress him in the shirt, wrap the wrapper around him, and envelop him in the shroud like a robe and place him on the wood. If you fear anything will come loose from the shrouds, tie it. Then his washing is complete. When asked about how many shrouds a man is wrapped in, Zaid answered: Three garments: a shirt, a wrapper, and a shroud. When asked how many shrouds a woman is wrapped in, he said: Five garments: a dress, a head covering, a wrapper, a band to tie the shrouds, and a shroud.

english_translation: Narrated from Ali: When asked about a man whose wife has died, whether he should see anything from her, he said: No, except what a stranger would see. Zaid ibn Ali said regarding a man who dies while traveling with his wife: She washes him and does not intentionally look at his private parts. Zaid ibn Ali said regarding a woman who dies while traveling with her husband: He performs dry ablution for her, since the marital relationship has ended. She should wash him since she is still in her waiting period. Zaid ibn Ali said regarding a man who dies while traveling with a woman who is a mahram relative: He ties a covering above her clothes and pours water over her. Zaid ibn Ali said regarding a man who dies while traveling with women who are mahram relatives: They tie a covering, pour water over him, touch his body, but do not touch his private parts, and purify him. Zaid ibn Ali said: If a man dies among women, and there is no wife or mahram female relative among them, they tie a covering to his knees, pour water over him, do not touch him with their hands, do not look at his private parts, and purify him. Zaid ibn Ali said regarding a woman who dies while traveling with people among whom there is no mahram male relative: She is given dry ablution.

english_translation: Narrated by Ali: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ asked: Do you know who are the martyrs of my Ummah? They said: Yes, those who are killed in the way of Allah, patiently enduring and seeking reward. He said: The martyrs of my Ummah are indeed few, [then he listed:] those killed in the way of Allah Almighty, and the plague-stricken, and the one who dies of diarrhea, and the one buried by a collapsing structure, and the drowned, and the woman who dies in childbed. They asked: And how does the woman die in childbirth? He said: The fetus turns in her womb and she dies.

english_translation: Narrated by Ali: Carry the deceased by taking the right hand first, then the right foot, then the left hand, then the left foot. Then there is no obligation upon you to do this except once. If you carry him three times, you have fulfilled your obligation, and whatever additional carrying you do is better, as long as you do not disturb anyone. Additionally, Asma bint Umays was the first to innovate the shroud.

english_translation: Narrated from Ali: In the funeral prayer, in the first takbir begin with praise and glorification of Allah Almighty. In the second takbir send blessings upon the Prophet ﷺ. In the third takbir make supplication for yourself and the believers, both men and women. In the fourth takbir make supplication for the deceased and seek forgiveness for him. In the fifth takbir make takbir then give the salutation.

english_translation: Narrated from Ali: When there are funeral processions with both men and women together, the men are positioned toward the Imam and the women toward the Qiblah. Ali used to raise his hands in the first takbir then not raise them afterward. When asked about one who misses part of the takbirs, Zaid said: He should not make takbir until the Imam makes takbir. When the Imam finishes, he completes what he missed following the Imam's takbirs in succession. When praying for a male, Ali would stand at his chest, and if it was a female, he would stand opposite her chest.
